intro: Lacinaria scariosa var. virginiana, commonly known as the Virginia lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and native garden landscapes.
